text: A traditional dish from Zihuatanejo made with thin strips of fresh fish marinated in lime juice and mixed with onion and chili. Light, refreshing, and emblematic of the town’s fishing heritage.

A lesser-known coastal sweet bread made with grated coconut, offering a soft texture and tropical flavor. Popular in local bakeries, it reflects the creative use of regional ingredients in Guerrero’s coast.
A traditional Zihuatanejo crab stew made with fresh crab, local herbs, tomatoes, and chili. Rich in flavor and deeply tied to the coastal culinary traditions of the region.
